channel.title: q-bio.PE updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: q-bio.PE updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The effect of demographic stochasticity on predatory-prey oscillations
item.description: arXiv:2310.20575v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The ecological dynamics of interacting predator and prey populations can display sustained oscillations, as for instance predicted by the Rosenzweig-MacArthur predator-prey model. The presence of demographic stochasticity, due to the finiteness of population sizes, alters the amplitude and frequency of these oscillations. Here we present a method for characterizing the effects of demographic stochasticity on the limit cycle attractor of the Rosenzweig-MacArthur. We show that an angular Brownian motion well describes the frequency oscillations. In the vicinity of the bifurcation point, we obtain an analytical approximation for the angular diffusion constant. This approximation accurately captures the effect of demographic stochasticity across parameter values.
item.dc:creator: Solmaz Golmohammadi, Mina Zarei, Jacopo Grilli

item.title: First two moments and cross-moments of some coalescent times of the pure birth tree
item.description: arXiv:2502.18159v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We present here a thorough study of the first two moments and cross-moments for the pure birth tree's height and for the coalescent time of a randomly sampled pair of tips. We consider also the first two moments of the conditional, on the tree, expectation of this coalescent time.
item.dc:creator: Krzysztof Bartoszek, Bayu Brahmantio, Woodrow Hao Chi Kiang
